intro: Cuviera djalonensis, commonly known as the Djalonensis Cuviera, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth surface, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
